When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you.
You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen.
At least that is what happened in my dream last night.
In real life, only pets are reincarnated.
Some people think that family members come back as pets.
My friend's family thought their cat was their grandmother.
They always had a place set for her at the table with cat food in the dish.
My cats have shown many signs of being reinicarnated as my former pets, but I have no clear feeling that she has lived before.
Maybe this is the first life.
I mean, there has to have been a start with some pet, right?
I would love to have my former dog, Samantha reincarnated.
Or even better, I'd just love to have her back.
She was the best dog I have ever had and that is to say the least!
The first evidence of reincarnation is from early Egyptian culture.
The Egyptians believed in many gods, and since animals were considered to be living gods, they believed that humans could reincarnate into animals.
I have a hard time seeing animals as gods, but I sure agree that theyi are sacred beings!
Mummified cats are found in the tombs of pharaohs, because they were thought to be companions in life and death.
I like that concept, but I don't think it is true.
Some people need reincarnation to help them feel better about death.
It is not a harmful belief unless you are Judeo-Christion or Muslim.
They believe more in death, then on to an afterlife as a person.
Reincarnation is just one of many life and death beliefs.
